questions.question: What is the study of the structure of body parts and their relationships to one another?
Which of the following is NOT a level of structural organization in the human body?
What is homeostasis?
choices: The maintenance of a stable internal environment
The breakdown of nutrients for energy
questions.answer: The maintenance of a stable internal environment

questions.question: Which term describes the front of the body?
What plane divides the body into left and right portions?
Which of the following is an example of an organ system?
What is the basic unit of life?
Which feedback mechanism is most common in maintaining homeostasis?
What term describes a position closer to the midline of the body?
Which plane separates the front from the back of the body?
What is the study of the function of body parts and the body as a whole?
Which of the following is NOT one of the four main tissue types?
What term describes a position farther from the point of attachment or origin?
Which of the following is an example of positive feedback in the body?
What term describes a position above or toward the head?
Which level of structural organization is composed of two or more tissue types?
What is the standard reference position used in anatomy?
Which of the following is NOT a body cavity?
What term describes structures closer to the surface of the body?
Which of the following is an example of homeostasis?
What plane divides the body into superior and inferior portions?
Which term describes a position below or toward the feet?
What is the correct order of structural organization from simplest to most complex?
choices: Chemical, cellular, tissue, organ, organ system
Cellular, chemical, tissue, organ, organ system
Tissue, cellular, chemical, organ, organ system
Chemical, tissue, cellular, organ, organ system
questions.answer: Chemical, cellular, tissue, organ, organ system

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a directional term used in anatomy?
What is the primary function of negative feedback in the body?
choices: To amplify changes in the body

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an organ?
What term describes the back of the body?
Which of the following is NOT a component of the chemical level of organization?
What is the primary advantage of using standardized anatomical terminology?
choices: It makes anatomy easier to learn
It allows for precise descriptions of body locations
It reduces the need for medical imaging
questions.answer: It allows for precise descriptions of body locations

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the relationship between anatomy and physiology?
choices: They are completely separate fields of study
Anatomy is a subset of physiology
Physiology is a subset of anatomy
They are interrelated and complementary disciplines
questions.answer: They are interrelated and complementary disciplines
